intro: Barkhausia albida var. macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed white barkhouseia, is a South African plant belonging to the Restionaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and dense, grass-like foliage. The plant produces striking white to pale blue flower heads that are clustered in terminal paniculate inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its unique appearance and hardiness.
